1.text: A wise son heeds his father’s discipline, but a mocker does not listen to rebuke.

2.text: From the fruit of his lips a man enjoys good things, but the desire of the faithless is violence.

3.text: He who guards his mouth protects his life, but the one who opens his lips invites his own ruin.

4.text: The slacker craves yet has nothing, but the soul of the diligent is fully satisfied.

5.text: The righteous hate falsehood, but the wicked bring shame and disgrace.

6.text: Righteousness guards the man of integrity, but wickedness undermines the sinner.

7.text: One pretends to be rich, but has nothing; another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.

8.text: Riches may ransom a man’s life, but a poor man hears no threat.

9.text: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is extinguished.

10.text: Arrogance leads only to strife, but wisdom is with the well-advised.

11.text: Dishonest wealth will dwindle, but what is earned through hard work will be multiplied.

12.text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but desire fulfilled is a tree of life.

13.text: He who despises instruction will pay the penalty, but the one who respects a command will be rewarded.

14.text: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, turning one from the snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding wins favor, but the way of the faithless is difficult.

16.text: Every prudent man acts with knowledge, but a fool displays his folly.

17.text: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a faithful envoy brings healing.

18.text: Poverty and shame come to him who ignores discipline, but whoever heeds correction is honored.

19.text: Desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but turning from evil is detestable to fools.

20.text: He who walks with the wise will become wise, but the companion of fools will be destroyed.

21.text: Disaster pursues sinners, but prosperity is the reward of the righteous.

22.text: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, but the sinner’s wealth is passed to the righteous.

23.text: Abundant food is in the fallow ground of the poor, but without justice it is swept away.

24.text: He who spares the rod hates his son, but he who loves him disciplines him diligently.

25.text: A righteous man eats to his heart’s content, but the stomach of the wicked is empty.
